Detailed Description

Database file storage configuration.

Initialize with db_file_storage_config_init, destroy with db_file_storage_config_destroy.

See also
db_create_file_storage, db_open_file_storage

Field Documentation

◆ file_mode

db_file_storage_config_t::file_mode

Options for opening a database.

No flags are set by default. Available flags are:

  • DB_READ_ONLY: Open database for reading only.
  • DB_NOLOGGING: Disable logging.
  • DB_NOLOCKING: Disable locking.
  • DB_UTF8_NAME: File name is in UTF-8 encoding, default is ANSI encoding.
  • DB_ATOMIC_WRITE: Write database pages atomically, even if the storage media does not support atomic writes.
  • DB_CONN_LOCK: Wait for connection lock instead of try lock.
  • #DB_VERIFY_PAGE_CHECKSUM:

◆ page_size

db_file_storage_config_t::page_size

The size of a page in bytes.

The default value is 4096.

If storing to a file, this should be a multiple of the block size used by the filesystem. Otherwise, use a multiple of DB_MIN_PAGE_SIZE.

Set this value before creating a database to control the size of a data page. Once a database has been created, the size of a data page cannot be changed.

See also
DB_MIN_PAGE_SIZE, DB_MAX_PAGE_SIZE, DB_DEF_PAGE_SIZE

◆ buffer_count

db_file_storage_config_t::buffer_count

The number of buffers in the database cache.

The default value is DB_DEF_BUFFER_COUNT.

To provide efficient access to database files, recently used pages are kept in a cache in memory. This option controls how much memory is used by the database cache. Each buffer is the size of a page, so the total size of the cache is page_size * buffer_count.

The buffer count is ignored if storage_cache_size is set to a non-default value when opening or creating a storage.

See also
DB_MIN_BUFFER_COUNT, DB_MAX_BUFFER_COUNT, DB_DEF_BUFFER_COUNT

◆ flush_buffers

db_file_storage_config_t::flush_buffers

This defines the maximum number of buffers that can be flushed during background flushing in a single operation.

The default value is DB_DEF_FLUSH_BUFFERS.

Note
This value is ignored in the current version of ITTIA DB and is only provided for forward compatibility.
See also
DB_MIN_FLUSH_BUFFERS, DB_DEF_FLUSH_BUFFERS

◆ journal_type

db_file_storage_config_t::journal_type

Options:

  • DB_INTERNAL_JOURNAL Journal and data are stored in a single file.
  • DB_EXTERNAL_JOURNAL Journal is stored in a separate file.

◆ checkpoint_interval

db_file_storage_config_t::checkpoint_interval

Specifies how many journal pages should be written before a checkpoint is inserted.

The default value is DB_DEF_CHECKPOINT_INTERVAL.

All modifications to the database are recorded in a journal to facilitate recovery. Checkpoints are periodically inserted into the journal to improve recovery performance and allow old journal entries to be deleted. Inserting a checkpoint requires a small extra time overhead.

A high checkpoint interval will slightly increase the average speed of database operations. A low checkpoint interval will save storage space by preventing the journal from becoming excessively large. A low checkpoint interval also ensures faster recovery if the application crashes.

See also
DB_MIN_CHECKPOINT_INTERVAL, DB_MAX_CHECKPOINT_INTERVAL, DB_DEF_CHECKPOINT_INTERVAL

◆ preallocate

db_file_storage_config_t::preallocate

The number of journal pages to allocate when the journal becomes full.

The default value is 10.

Larger values improve performance at the cost of an increased journal size.

See also
DB_MIN_PREALLOCATE_PAGES, DB_MAX_PREALLOCATE_PAGES, DB_DEF_PREALLOCATE_PAGES

◆ crypt

db_file_storage_config_t::crypt

Encryption callbacks for user cipher.

To enable encryption with a custom cipher, set the cipher_type to DB_CIPHER_USER and implement the encrypt and decrypt functions. An encrypted database must always be opened with the same encryption algorithm that was used when it was created.

◆ memory_page_size

db_file_storage_config_t::memory_page_size

Page size (in bytes) for memory tables and indexes.

Use any value between 512 and 32768.

◆ memory_storage_size

db_file_storage_config_t::memory_storage_size

Total memory (in bytes) to allocate for memory tables and indexes.

This must be a multiple of memory_page_size.

◆ journal_buffers

db_file_storage_config_t::journal_buffers

Number of buffers to allocate for the journal.

The size of each buffer is the larger of page_size and memory_page_size.

◆ target_address

db_file_storage_config_t::target_address

Verify replication address.

If the storage has a different replication address, attempting to open it will cause a DB_EREP_INVADDRESS error. Use #DB_REP_ADDRESS_NONE to disable this check.

◆ source_address

db_file_storage_config_t::source_address

Reserved.

Use #DB_REP_ADDRESS_NONE.

◆ udcp_param

db_file_storage_config_t::udcp_param

Parameter for a user-defined connection protocol.

Use NULL unless custom UDCP settings are required for this connection.

◆ auth_info

db_file_storage_config_t::auth_info

Authorization credentials for database security.

Use NULL unless the storage is encrypted or password-protected.

◆ storage_cache_segment

db_file_storage_config_t::storage_cache_segment

Pointer to a segment of memory reserved for the database buffer cache.

The segment pointer is only used by the first local connection to each database file. If the file storage is already open or mounted, or when connecting to a remote URI, the segment pointer is ignored. Otherwise, if the segment pointer is NULL, the cache is dynamically allocated.

◆ storage_cache_size

db_file_storage_config_t::storage_cache_size

The number of bytes in the database cache.

The default value is DB_DEF_STORAGE_CACHE_SIZE.

When creating or opening a storage, a non-default storage cache size overrides buffer_count.
